description:
The Earth was attacked by the aliens and it is in danger! 
But, if you cooperate with each other, you can save it.

Invaders is a cooperative and memory-based game that is played in two phases:

     the "planning" one where you have to deploy your interceptors based on the aliens that are drawn at every turn
     the "invasion" one, where you check how well you did in the planning phase (and where you have few chances to correct your mistakes)


It contains 5 different difficulty levels, each introducing new material and rules.

—description from the designer

In the heart of London, innocent victims are at the mercy of a fearsome serial killer. Only you can save them. Investigate but watch out for time... the crime doesn't wait!

The Escape Room range is inspired by the Escape Room rooms. Find their incredible atmosphere at home! Go on an adventure, observe, manipulate and solve various puzzles that will put your logical mind to the test.

This Escape Game contains 8 scenarios of 60 minutes each.

It's 10 am and the Animalia Stock Exchange opens its doors, attracting many investors in search of the best business opportunities. Jacques and Marie, a couple of rabbits, want to secure a quick profit on Carotte Orange SCA shares. Felipe, the shark, tries to convince Karl, the pig, that Peixe Azul S.A. It's a good deal, but the pig is only interested in Roter Apfel AG, whose shares have already earned him good profits recently. Hank the bull is confident of Green Grass Inc.'s rising profits, but Sofia the bear prefers to be more cautious and make a safe investment in Miele Giallo S.p.A. Finally, Harshad, the wolf, tries to convince everyone that he is a successful investor, but there are rumors that he became a millionaire with a pyramid scheme. Before the Exchange closes its operations, anything can happen! Who will raise both arms and shout “STONKS!” in celebration?

Stonks it's a trick taking and stock market game. One of the players leads the trick by playing a card and everyone must follow suit. Whoever played the highest card wins the trick and chooses one of the played cards to put in the wallet. All cards have shares, which yield victory points according to the companies' market value. Some cards, when used, allow the player to modify a company's stock exchange rate, either in his favor or to ruin  opponents dreams. After all cards are used, the player with the most victory points is the winner.

-description from designer

OUTWIT YOUR FRIENDS
Make up fake answers to real trivia questions and score points when you psych out your friends in this hilarious party game based on the popular app.

BRING TO YOUR NEXT PARTY
Choose a category and read the question, make up an answer and pin it to the board, then wait and see who you psyched out. Win even more points if you pick the right answer.

4 FUN CATEGORIES
Features 4 different categories for you to psych out your friends: Is That A Fact, Word Up, Movie Bluff and The Truth Comes Out. Shuffle them all together for a more random game.

Includes: 1 Gameboard, 2 Paper Pads, 200 Cards, 1 Magnetic Pin Board, 8 Movers, 1 Magnet Sheet, 1 Sticker Sheet, Instructions.

Skellington is a may-follow trick-taker played with dominoes. The relative strength of the suits may change from trick-to-trick but the players’ choices will dictate how the strength will change.

You can play any tile you wish, in whichever orientation is best. Each tile is worth the difference from its highest number to its lowest number (e.g., a 6-1 tile is worth 5 tile points).

There are 71 tile points to capture each round (a bonus tile point is awarded to the last trick winner). However, only the side that takes the majority of these points will score victory points.

Sun, surf, sand… and serial killers. It’s 1970-something in California, hippy culture is rife, things are getting groovy, and serial murders are at their peak. Public panic is high but arrests are still low, so you and your fellow investigators (or just a bunch of friends) have been tasked with solving these heinous crimes.

Crimewave: California is a hidden movement co-op game. Players choose to play as one of the investigator roles or take on the task of controlling the three criminals.

One player operates as all three killers, who reside in secret locations across the board. On each turn, that player places down crime scenes to try and increase public panic and outsmart the investigators.

On their turn, investigators will move around the board in an effort to locate the killers' residences. Their goal is to work together to find out where the killers are residing by piecing together crime scenes. Investigators also roll dice to try and verify evidence at different crime scenes, which they'll use during the trial phase.

When the investigators successfully take the killers to trial, they go into a courtroom face-off and play defense and prosecution cards to try and increase and decrease their own score.

The winner is the player with the highest card score at the end of the trial. For the investigators, the way to win the game is to jail all three killers. Alternatively, if the public panic marker reaches 10 before the killers are jailed, the player controlling all three killers wins the game.

In this game, you own a travel agency. Your task will be to manage touristic regions in Hungary. This time, you will focus on natural values: hills, lakes etc.
From season to season, you must upgrade services (like hiking trails, historical places) and build attractions in your regions, then attract tourists to earn money and victory points.
At the end of the game, the player with the most victory points will be the winner.

Strands is a hard-to-master 2-player puzzle game with rules that fit in two tweets:


1. To start, Black covers any space marked “2”.

2. From then on, starting with White, the players take turns. On your turn, cover up to X empty spaces marked “X”. For example, you could cover any 3 empty spaces marked “3”.

3. The game ends when the board’s full. The player with largest contiguous group of stones wins. If tied, compare the players’ second-largest groups, and so on, until you come to a pair which aren’t the same size. Whoever owns the larger wins


The numbers on the board make the game's interface clear and intuitive, and they balance the value of the board's spaces.

The board's center is the most powerful place to put pieces, but you can place more pieces per turn near the edge. You must navigate this tradeoff to win.

Read the Strands Strategy Primer here.

Read the Strands page at the designer's site here here.

The Crimean Campaign, 1941 -42 (TCC) is a strategic level two-player wargame (with strong operational undertones) of low-intermediate complexity covering the fighting across the peninsula that climaxed with the German capture of Sevastopol.

The action simulated in the game took place historically between 28 October 1941 and 4 July 1942. The first date marks the German entry into the Crimea via the Perekop Isthmus, while the second marks the end of organized Soviet resistance across the whole peninsula. Those nine calendar months are divided into chronologically varied and unequal numbers of turns. That approach allows for the convenient simulation of the ebbs and flows in the action that took place due to bad weather and logistical and command-control constraints.

The Perekop Isthmus fight, which took place from 24 September through 27 October, just off-map to the north, is not included in the game because it took place across terrain too restrictive to allow for maneuver by either side. At this scale it would have come down to how lucky the German player got in rolling his inescapably low-range and mid-range initial frontal attacks. So that episode is considered to have taken place as the last act of the Dniepr River campaign rather than the first act in the Crimean campaign.

—description from the publisher

Great European War is a Strategic level two-player wargame of an alternative World War II in Europe, based on the premise that Adolf Hitler did not order the invasion of the Soviet Union in June 1941. Instead, the Axis goes over to a naval-air offensive against the British with additional operations in North Africa and the Middle East, while waiting for America to enter the war and keeping a watchful eye on Stalin who may intervene.

The game assumes that the Western Allies decide on a Europe First Strategy, diverting forces and logistics from the Pacific. The Axis is under pressure to win the war before economic collapse sets in, the Allies to win before the Japanese seize too much of the Pacific. Given the shift in Axis logistics and planning against the British Empire and the US. only the westernmost Soviet Union is shown on the map, but there is emphasis on North Africa and the Middle East.

There are two players: Axis and Allied (to include the Western Allies and the Soviet Union). Both players can develop orders of battle by expending Mobilization Points. The game shows the war in Europe during the early and mid-war years before the full Allied buildup. Both sides will be fighting a war which is markedly different from that fought in the historical event. The game ends in 1943, the time when the Western Allies originally planned to return to Europe.

—description from the publisher

In ã‚¢ãƒ¡ãƒŽã‚­ãƒªãƒ•ãƒ€ (Ameno Kirifuda), players play a trick-taking game where the winner of a trick places a chip on a 4x4 grid in the row corresponding to the suit of the card they played.

The suits of the cards represent the seasons, and the trump mechanism used is that the lead suit is subordinate to the "next season".

In addition to the cards used to take tricks, players draft cards which will grant points based upon having chips in certain suit patterns on the board.  Players also earn points for having chips on the board, regardless of these cards.

The game lasts for two rounds and the person with the most points wins.

Any number of persons can play the Game, from two up. The mode of playing the Game with but two Players is different than when played by three or more.

It will be seen that the Deck is composed of Books consisting of four Cards each, and the name of the Book is indicated by the center line in large type on all four Cards constituting any one book. The top line of each Card indicates which particular Card that Card is of a certain book. The three bottom names on each Card indicate, for the convenience of the Player, what the names or top lines of the other Cards composing that particular Book are.

The object in a game is for a Player to acquire all the Cards composing any one Book. When he has accomplished this he places the four Cards on the table before him to be counted as one trick at the end of the Game, unless he shall lose said Book in the manner described in the following rules.

Company of Heroes, the World War 2 board wargame, is based on the video game from Relic/Sega. It closely captures the choices, tactics and mission strategies of the videogame. In teams, or as individuals, players will maneuver units and battle for control points to collect manpower, munitions and fuel. Players spend these resources to construct new buildings, purchase units and upgrade abilities, eventually unlocking the powerful end-game units of their nation.

The second edition of the Company of Heroes introduces extensive improvements to gameplay, tactical choices, unit balance, faction differentiation, mission parameters and more.

The 2nd edition adjusts unit and building costs, resource generation and other mechanics to allow for more units to be purchased, fielded and used over the course of the battle. It so  further tweaked and balanced units, factions and commanders to a high polish. These changes were incorporated with an eye towards emphasizing faction identity and distinction.

-description from publisher

A light, fast-playing card game for 2-6 players featuring player interaction, some backstabbing, and a healthy dose of humor. Picture the office meets Sword & Sorcery.  Work for an Evil Overlord—a tyrannical, ruthless, megalomaniacal villain bent on world domination. launch an epic competition of subterfuge, deceit, and backstabbing to prove who is most worthy to become the next Henchman!

A modified deck builder with the entire deck building mechanic occurring at the beginning of the game. Players choose from the 6 minion characters each with their own advantages and natural skills.
The game begins with the Minion Working Phase which is divided in rounds. Each round is split into a series of  steps for each minion to complete: assign tasks, initialize time, demonstrate skills, complete tasks and refresh hands to earn points, skills and reputation. One player acts as the MIC (Minion in Charge) and uses the task deck to indicate status. This is the time to demonstrate delegation and negotiation skills to curry favor with the Evil Overlord (EO).

The MIC draws a number of tasks equal to the number of minions under their delegation. The MIC then hands out these tasks to minions as they see fit for them to complete, managing time. Any tasks not completed will an increase to the Evil Overlord Annoyance tracker (the EO has no tolerance for minions who cannot complete simple tasks!) Any tasks the MIC chooses not to complete will cost them time and points as will any failed tasks by minions. Be careful your minions could choose to strategize against you to become the next MIC. Minions complete tasks to demonstrate skills, gain abilities, points and reputation in attempt to take over as the next MIC to get their chance to please the EO and become the henchman.

The game ends if there are not enough tasks to assign to  minions including reshuffled tasks. The minion that has gained the most reputation points earns the respect of the Evil Overlord and is declared the Henchman and the winner of the game.

Spin for your chance to make it to the top first. Use teamwork to find the best way up but watch out, a fall is only a spin away

Players have two different climbers with pegs in their feet. They spin a spinner and climb up the side of the mountain but watch out! Their is only room for one climber in each peg so your opponent can very quickly knock you out! First to have both climbers to the top wins.

—user summary

The players take turns to roll and move. On some spaces events hinder or benefit the players. The first player to reach the harbor of Sonderburg (space 100) wins the game.

Plastic sailships were available as supplements to bags of Harry-Sonderburger bread.

Under the watchful eye of the old druid Alarún, you will collect mysterious ingredients, obtain the rarest herb and mix and match them into powerful potions. Secretly score bonus points and take over Alarún's  migthy staff as the best druid apprentice.

Alarún is a card game with more depth in it then you would have thought at first sight.

The game of Alarún plays in 8 rounds, each in the same way. In these 8 rounds you place 24 ingredients that form your magic square of 5x5 cards. Your druid apprentice completes your magic square.

During a round you chose 1 of the 3 available actions, after the first player passes every other player can take 1 more action.


     Swap 1 ingredient from your hand with 1 of the 3 ingredients that are face up in the centre of the table.
     Pass Do not swap an ingredient.
     Swap and pass: Swap all 3 ingredients from your hand with all 3 ingredients that are face up in the centre of the table. This is a pass at the same time.


Score most points by brewing powerful potions and scoring bonus points along the way. During the game you collect 24 ingredients and combine them in the best possible way into your own magic 5x5 square. At the end of the game your magic square is complete. The ingredients in every row and every column form potions that will score you points, based on the prerequisites.

The adult card game about describing your Richards. How do you decide Victory? By claiming to have the Longest, Shortest, Thickest, or Thinnest picture of Richard in your hand. Any Challengers? Whip out the ruler card and see which Richard is best! No matter what party you're in, Tricky Dicks will fit right in.

Go around in a circle playing cards and claiming if you have the biggest, smallest, thickets, or thinnest and compare with your opponents. Most points at the end of the game wins!

—description from the publisher

Corral the robots by color or type, and the first to empty their hand wins!

To begin the game, each player is dealt 5 robots which they lay face-up in front of them. An additional robot is placed face-up next to the draw pile. On each player's turn, they can play a robot from their hand that matches the type or color of the top robot on the discard pile. If they cannot play, they must instead draw one robot and end their turn. A wild card can be used at any time, and the player can select which color they want it to represent.

The first player to play all of their cards wins.

The Path Seekers is a sandbox tabletop experience that brings players back to an ancient China fantasy world. You are playing as one of the young protagonists who starts off with a modest background. With tremendous hard work and determination, you set off living your dream to make a difference in this treacherous time.

On players' turn, they will perform up to 3 main actions using multi-use Actions cards to move around and interact with locations on the board to improve their protagonist's attributes, and to befriend all kinds of interesting characters to help you with their special powers.

You may travel to visit different clans, learn from more than 20 new skills in the form of Action cards to execute more challenging missions, explore the uncharted cave for what lies within or hunt dangerous animals to gain precious resources and go on many more adventures. Prestige will be earned in many ways from successful missions, event interactions, gold and virtue etc.

At the end of nine months, the player with the most Prestige will be titled the winner.

Will you succeed on your quests to gain a prestigious reputation or succumb to the growing pressure and regress into obscurity? Your journey starts now as The Path Seekers.

-description from designer

In this escape game for kids, you visit your school while it is closed. After a few seconds it gets really scary: the entrance gate suddenly closes and you can't get out!

Just like in a real Escape Room, you are locked in a mysterious place. Now you have to work together to find the exit by solving logic puzzles and mathematical problems and looking very carefully. Use the objects you find during your adventure, pay attention to even the smallest details and don't be in a hurry: if you manage to solve all the puzzles correctly, you can escape and be safe.

Carcassonne basic game including 11 expansions!
The game of the year from 2001 and 11 expansions are combined in this new Carcassonne BigBox - the perfect starter set for Carcassonne fans and anyone who wants to get to know the best-selling game in all its diversity.

Now with a new cardboard inlay. It is perfect for sorting the included expansions more easily and finding them again quickly. The tiles of the new BigBox are still unchanged and compatible with the other games and expansions.

You can combine all expansions and with over 180 tiles you can design your own combination of games as you like and experience endless fun.

The included expansions:

Inns & Cathedrals - These make cities and roads more valuable - but only if they are completed at the end of the game! Each player gains a large meeple to allow them to claim features quickly.

Traders & Builders - Traders vie for goods in the cities, while builders allow players to take multiple turns and accelerate the construction of roads and cities. Pigs on a farm can increase a farmer's yield.

The Abbot - The abbot likes to spend his day in the monastery, but he likes to pass the time in gardens in the countryside even more.

The River - The river creates varied setups at the beginning of each game, and winds through the landscape in a beautiful blue course.

The Flying Machine - Resourceful tinkerers have made their dreams of flight come true, and it's time to test their magnificent flying machines. How long the can fly, and they'll land, is still quite unpredictable.

The Messengers - The Queen sends dispatches to her loyal subjects which, if used skillfully, can be the key to attaining wealth and prestige.

The Ferries - There are many small lakes with ferries all around Carcassonne, giving travelers a great deal more variety.

The Gold Mines - We've struck gold! it's a thrilling time, and everyone wants to secure the precious metals. However, you won't know how much each gold bar is worth until the end of the game.

Mage & Witch - Magic spreads across the land! The mage causes cities and other features to flourish, while the witch can curse your opponents' favors.

The Robbers - Robbers are on the prowl, ready to steal points from your high-scoring opponents.

The Crop Circles - Mysterious circles appear in the fields, influencing the lives of knights and farmers in bizarre ways.

In your hands you have an investigative case that you can play alone or with friends. It takes little space, a bit of time and a lot of ingenuity. 
But remember, one case leads to another!

Six chapters for six compact boxes to carry with you in every situation: the box itself contains the rules of the game, and along with the deck of cards contained in it, it will be enough to get all the clues necessary to the resolution!

MiniCrimes is a cooperative investigative game in which you'll put your observation and deduction skills to the test to solve a mysterious case. You'll analyze a crime scene and up to 10 clues. 
Choose carefully and solve the mystery!

'In Mini Crimes: La fine dei giochi' ("Mini Crimes: The end of the games"), a fan of comics, toys and science fiction is found dead in his house, hit on the head by a vase.
How can a simple person loved by all make such a terrible end?

-description from publisher

What do you do when the world’s gone pear shaped? How about play our fast and frantic game, ‘Pear Shaped’ for a rocking good time!

Round up your nearest & dearest, pull back the rocking pear timer and let the game begin.

The rules? You can match by object, colour or number… but if there's an exact match, all bets are off and it’s a race against your fellow gamers to grab the rocking pear!

Objective: To get rid of all of your cards by playing matching cards into the play pile. The first player to get rid of all the cards in their hand and draw pile is the winner.

Family, friends, coworkers - this is the pear-fect game for everyone!

Oh, and don’t forget to “do the Shakes Pear” when the timer stops or when you win! (aka rock side to side in triumph).... We’re so going to get some music for the Shakes Pear! - Got any ideas?

-description from publisher's website

The only purpose of the players is to make more money than anyone else.
With limited information, let's dispatch a person to manipulate the information and take control of the market.
Aim for the legendary Akind that will remain in posterity!

in this game players will obtain a set number of goods and know the value of 1 of the types. players then must use worker placement to trade the goods they have and effect the market value of their goods.

A family-friendly party card game with simple rules & reversal elements.

Here we are is cat café which is topic of the street. You are the staff of this shop. Cats are relaxing around. When the time goes by slowly, one of the staff whispered, "Who is most liked by them?"

You do everything to the cats. Of course, to be the most favorite of the cats in this shop.

--from the publisher

Each round, the staff of this cat café must try and guess what the cat is going to want from them. You'll know which of the four cat decks is going to be drawn from next, and if you've been paying attention, you should have an idea of the cards left in that deck. You'll play one of your four prediction cards, and either gain or lose the cat's favorability.

But be careful which prediction card you play, because you only have one of each! You can play your 'Leave Me Alone' card to avoid losing favorability, and to return all your cards back to your hand.

You also have a 'Full Power' card you can use when you're really confident in your prediction. If you guessed right, you can get a favorability bonus - either +5, +15, x3, or even x4 - depending on where you are on the scoring track. But the 'Full Power' card has to rest for a while before it can be used again, so choose wisely!

The staff member who the cats like best wins!

Then the dreams overtook me. I conversed with the thousand poets long dead, they who trod the roads weaving toward eternity and never returned. In the morning’s warm embrace, my limbs felt their old vigor and the undeniable desire to travel. To seize the horizon. To behold hidden wonders. To exhume the words that will give life to my LAST HAIKU.

Last Haiku is a one-player adventure card game with a dose of creative writing. You are the latest in a long line of poets feeling your age, and you know you are not long for this world. Yet you also feel the call of distant, uncanny, and wondrous places where you might seek the inspiration to write one last haiku to leave to the ages to inspire future generations of poets, who may themselves discover stranger, more distant places to spark the words of their own haiku.

This is a “Make-as-You-Play” game, which means that the game starts with a few index cards and a pen. Each game will add new cards, either maps of locations or haiku your poet composed. The rules provide all the guidance you need for creating new cards and selecting the game’s thematic elements, which makes every copy of Last Haiku an evolving, unique world. In addition, it means that each game inherits all components added or changed in the previous games. There is no limit to the places you can visit and the poetry you can compose.

Each turn of the game involves playing cards of the appropriate distance. If the card was created in a previous game, your poet travels deeper into the frontier. If you cannot play an existing card, you create a new site on a card and your poet is inspired to write a line of haiku, these lines recorded on a separate card. The game ends when you have written each of three lines forming your poet’s last haiku, and your score equals the total of the distances of the new sites visited. Each new site and your haiku then enter the deck permanently.

-description from designer

In your hands you have an investigative case that you can play alone or with friends. It takes little space, a bit of time and a lot of ingenuity.
But remember, one case leads to another!

Six chapters for six compact boxes to carry with you in every situation: the box itself contains the rules of the game, and along with the deck of cards contained in it, it will be enough to get all the clues necessary to the resolution!

Mini Crimes is a cooperative investigative game in which you'll put your observation and deduction skills to the test to solve a mysterious case. You'll analyse a crime scene and up to 10 clues.
Choose carefully and solve the mystery!

In Mini Crimes: La strana coppa (Mini Crimes: The strange cup), the precious cup of a struggling football team has mysteriously disappeared from the headquarters, despite being kept in a alarmed case. 
How was that possible?

—description from the publisher

Create your own Australian farm in this tactical tile game. But watch out for toads! Queensland is besieged by a veritable toad infestation that is sweeping your farm too. The more toads you manage to remove through your ponds, the more points you earn. However, toads left on your farm will eat your crops. How much of your crop can you save from the toad infestation?

—description from the publisher (translated)

In Metro Domino, you use domino tiles to build metro lines across the city.

Each player starts with nine dominoes from a 9x9 set, and one random domino is placed in the central starting station. On a turn, you can draw a domino from the boneyard (i.e., the supply of dominoes) or place a domino at the end of an active line as long as you can match the number at the end of the line; the starting station can have two lines built off of the starting domino. If you place a double domino, take another turn immediately.

The starting station indicates that five dominoes must be placed in a line before a new station is opened. If you place the fifth domino in a line, draw a random station from the deck, then place it at the end of the line and mark it with one of your tokens. Each station has two lines off of it, with a starting domino half on each line and a length the line must reach before a new station is built on that line.

Players continue to take turns until either one player has emptied their hand of dominoes or the fifth station has been put into play. At the time, players score, earning 1 point for each station they started and losing 1 point for each domino still in hand.

Each city edition of Metro Domino appears to have identical gameplay, but with differing station lengths and values.

In the land of eagle hunters and herbalists, you represent a nomadic tribe. Face the tasks of the Great Shaman. You will be accompanied by your eagle and a power animal, your moose. The journey lasts 17 rounds, during which you can choose to explore landscapes or play cards to move your equestrian figure. En route, you'll need to use your strength well, as the landscape becomes more and more spacious. When you find fountains and reach them with your figure, you can fill up your water supply and extend the range of your cards. There are also some special actions, such as "deploy water." A highlight of the game are the power places with their mighty stone pines, which rise like peaks from a sea of fog, sink and reappear at another place ... Whoever gains the highest reputation wins.

The basic game is intended for beginners, which can be expanded to an expert game, including a solo variant. Three modules await you, with additional power animals (wolf, bear and snow leopard) and much more. A campaign combine all modules to the "Golden Journey."

-description from designer

Jok dice game:
Each player gets 1 meeple and starts at space 1 of the section of his color. The Players take turns to roll and move. On the roll of a 6 the player gets an extra roll. If a meeple gets on a prime number (framed spaces), the gets a "Jok"-token (joker). Each player may only get two tokens per game. The tokens may be used any time in the players turn to move the meeple up to 6 spaces forward. If a player already has 2 tokens or chooses not to tame one, he may move his meeple equal to the checksum of the prime number it occupies. 
Whenever a meeple gets on a number that can be divided by 11 (black spaces), it gets set back by the product of both digits. The 11 only counts as a prime number.
The first player to exactly reach space 100 wins the game.

Knight's move:
Each player gets 4 meeples which start at spaces 1, 2, 18 and 19. The meeples are moved in turns according to the knight's move in chess. All numbers that can be divided by 11 (black spaces) may not be occupied. The first player to get all his 4 meeples on space 100 wins the game.

—user summary

In Thornmar Abbey, an ancient order of holy knights watches over a sealed portal to the underworld. The knights must protect the elders—ancient sages who sustain the seal. After decades of peace, the seal has weakened and demons are emerging from the rift. The demons seek to battle past the valiant knights and kill enough of the elders to fully break the seal before morning. Imbued with the power of the gods, only these brave knights stand a chance of protecting the elders and stopping an army of monsters from flooding into the world.

Knight Fall is an asymmetrical team game for one to six players. One team controls the knights, who must protect the elders and withstand the demons until dawn. The other team controls the demons, who seek to break the seal to the underworld before morning.  

During the game, you choose a unique knight or demon, each with a variety of special powers—such as the Flame Knight’s ability to surround his foes in fire, or the Bone Crusher’s power to summon skeletal minions. The cards you play from your hand to perform actions can each be used in different ways, and a set of unique location tiles allows you to create the monastery with a different layout every game.

Knight Fall also features a campaign mode for one to two players. In this mode, you read stories while exploring the map of a haunted valley, drawing your path as you travel. Wander through crumbling churches, a sinister forest, and a dark mountain to stop the demons before the final battle at Thornmar Abbey. You must do whatever you can to keep your Knights alive; the death of each knight means one fewer hero to combat the invading demons in the final battle!

–description from designer

"Battle Array" is a set of 'fast play' wargame rules intended to simulate major battles from the ancient period until about 1500. It is played with miniatures or counters on a table top or board consisting of squares to regulate movement and distances and to speed up play by avoiding interaction and measurement issues. The system places less emphasis on weapons and more on training, quality and morale. Several historical battle scenarios are provided but, as usual in table top gaming players can also select their own armies and play 'random' battles such as Sumerian v 100 Years War French. The game is intended for experienced players and assumes that they know how to collect, paint and base figures and provide their own playing equipment such as dice, terrain and so on.

—description from the designer

Shining Shadows Saga is a strategy-based trading card game inspired by Japanese Role-Playing Games (JRPG). Using a customized deck of skills, spells, will, and other actionable cards, players battle in an arena-like fashion to knock out each others champions and become victorious.

Based on the recommendations of the Seer of Sanctuary, Azara, Monarchs can choose up to 3 ancient champions to take into battle. These champions from the past all hail from different realms within the world of Limsia where they once were revered by their respective species. Players take turns controlling their champions and use actionable cards that can cool down to be used again and the first player to deplete the HP of all of their opponents' champions is the winner.

As this is a strategy-heavy game, players can best strategize gameplay by using weapons and potions from their inventory to influence survivability and any attacks that are relevant to their champions of choice. New cards are released monthly so players can build as many unique and versatile decks as possible to vary their gameplay and avoid being locked in to specific play styles. With the number of champions growing, every battle provides a new ground for players of all skill levels to show off their customizations and strategies.

—description from the publisher

In a post-apocalyptic world, play a Prescient, an Ymune gifted with the power of precognition. Going down the Great River, explore the banks to rescue contaminated Humans, to hire Ymune Doctors to treat them, or Ymune Protectors to protect the boat from the banes to come. Try also to collect Batteries to activate the Machine rooms of your boat, or Food to feed the new healthy Humans…

In Precognition, you must truly see the future to win the game. That comes from understanding a new card mechanism: the Dual Select System. In addition to being innovative, the Dual Select System fits perfectly with the theme because, among the two cards that you will let pass, one of them will come back to you on the next turn. You have 12 turns to make the right choices.

Your goal is to have the most Healthy Humans at the end of the game. To keep the Humans you take in while working your way downstream, you will need Food, Doctors to treat them and Protectors to fight the Banes you’ll encounter. Good luck!

The game is played over 12 rounds. A round consists of 3 distinct phases. Each phase must be done by all the players at the same time.
I – Decision phase (secret): draw and choose cards according to the Dual Select System.
II – Action phase: Activate your cards to earn resources. If any of your powered machines can be used, benefit from its effects.
III – Maintenance phase : manage your Banes if you have suffer any, heal all possible contaminated Humans and move forward on the Great River from which you reveal and apply the event of the River tile.

At the end of a round, move forward by flipping over the River tile in front of the Progress pawn to discover the end-of-turn event. Each player applies that event’s effect. Every three rounds, it is the end of a season and it is when you feed the new healed Humans. Make sure you have enough food for everyone.

At the end of the third season, after feeding the Healthy Humans you have saved, count them. The player with the most Healthy Humans wins the game. If tied, the player with the most Healthy Humans and Contaminated Humans wins the game. If players are still tied, they share the victory.

—description from the publisher

Each player chooses his goal. Either he tries to get rid of all his cards or to collect two sets of cards from 1 to 6.

At the beginning each player is dealt 8 number cards and 2 "Ich will nicht (I don't want to)"-cards. The remaining "Ich will nicht"-cards are laid out in the middle of the table. The "ich will nicht"-cards are used as dummies when cards are exchanged to fool the 3rd player.

Each player has the following options to play his turn:


     The player rolls three dice. The result determines which  cards he may give to his left neighbor. He may choose as many cards as he wants as long as their combined value does not exceed the result of his roll.
     The player declares "Ich will nicht" and does nothing.
     The player takes 1 or 2 "Ich will nicht" cards from the Table
     The players places 1 or 2 "Ich will nicht" cards from his hand on the table.
     The player calls a number (1-6) or "Ich will nicht" cards. His left neighbor must show his hand. If he has more than 2 of these cards, he has to give one or both of the surplus cards to the active player and has to pay 5 coins for hoarding cards. In the other case the active player has to pay 2 coins for falsely accusing the other player.


—user summary

The ï¬rst two cards determine the gap into which we may play matching numbers.
     If you are able to play the last card into the gap, you get the trick and thus points.
     Special cards allow more clever tactics.


—description from the publisher (translated)


     Die ersten beiden Karten bestimmen die Lücke, in die wir passende Zahlen spielen dürfen.
     Konntest du die letzte Karte in die Lücke spielen, bekommst du den Stich und damit Punkte.
     Sonderkarten ermöglichen dir noch mehr clevere Taktiken.


—description from the publisher

Mine Your Business is a quick and tricky spatial puzzle that encourages clever planning and pattern recognition, all while being sparkly. The game features many modes of play, including solo, cooperative, and competitive rule sets.

In each mode, you will take actions on your turn to manipulate the game board and attempt to align chains of resources, so that they may be collected once your mine cart is aligned with them. You will do this by swapping, rotating, and revealing the different resource cards that make up the game board.

There is also a hungry goblin within the mine which will do its best to destroy your recently created resource paths, as well as try and eat you! Make sure you do everything in your power to avoid the goblin, and wisely utilize the tools available to you. The cleverest gnomes may even catch the goblin, eliminating it from the game!

Take care to avoid the dangers of the quarry, and steer clear of your pesky adversary. Sneak around dangerous creatures, enchant the land, and Mine Your Business!

The game will end when the mine carts belonging to each player have reached the end of the board, or if a goblin eats even a single gnome. The player with the most resources at the end of the game will stake the claim as Major Miner!

Pavé is an original kiwi strategy game.

A two player path building game played across a grid that is deceptively simple, emergently complex, and ruthlessly competitive, Pavé is a timeless game for all ages.

Pavé is a very simple game to play and understand. It has fewer rules than you expect.

To start the game each player grabs 5 Pavé tokens from the bag
Your goal is to use the paths on the tokens to connect your 2 board edges while your opponent is trying to connect the other 2 edges.

You alternate playing tokens, and top up after each turn.
Tokens may also be stacked to redirect the path.

The first player with a completed path to call "Pave" wins the round.

The core game concepts are:

Randomization
    Hidden Information
    Connections
    A Dynamic Board State

Pavé tests the player’s skills of

Pattern Recognition
    Spatial awareness
    Strategy and Planning
    Calculating Probability
    Bluffing and reading bluffs

Olymplakks is a revolutionary board game that brings together more than 12 sports in an epic competition. From traditional sports such as basketball, hockey, bowling, and football to more unique events such as climbing, petanque and high jumping, this game has it all.

Players must use strategy and skill to successfully complete each challenge. The game is played as follows:

• START: Strategically hit your disc and watch out for your opponents because they can hit your disc and change your position. 
• PICK THE CARD: Depending on where the disc has landed, you must pick one of the following cards: Group Card, Individual Card, Draw Card, Positive Card, and Negative Card.
• MINI-GAMES: Perform the mini-games and depending on the cards and results obtained in each event, points are either added to or subtracted from the scoreboard.
• ACCUMULATE POINTS: Once the players have all played the cards that have been dealt to them, the disc is thrown again, one at a time. Accumulate points by passing the mini-games to win the game.

The first one to reach 100 points wins.

—description from the publisher

In Joan of Arc: Orléans Draw & Write, 1-5 players draft followers that will help them move about France, gather goods, build buildings, establish trading stations, make money, and contribute to beneficial deeds. The player who can best utilize the followers they choose will score the most points and win.

In slightly more detail, each round, a number of follower tiles are pulled from a bag. Players take turns drafting the followers and taking actions that correspond to the follower they've chosen. After all the followers have been drafted, the bag resets until you've exhausted one bag per player.

In the solo mode, you compete directly against Joan of Arc at one of three difficulty levels.

—description from the designer

The Three Little Pigs is a fantastic building game.
Build the houses of the three little pigs like in the fairy tale! Roll the dice to collect all the pieces of the wooden house, the brick house and the straw house. Thanks to the interlocking puzzle, learn to recognize colors and shapes and ... Always be careful of the wolf!

Each player has to build a set of houses consisting of a thatched house, one of wood and one of bricks.

It is played in turns, clockwise. If you are the smallest, you will be the first to play! The goal is to build first all the houses.

On your turn, after sorting the house tiles, roll the die and see what happens!

Strange noises come from the house!

Legend has it that on the longest night of the year, in the haunted Whippole Manor, the terrible Ghost Buu and his henchmen wake up and go around the city to scare the inhabitants. Only a brave hero can stop them, finding the only thing inside the house that calms Buu and makes him return to his age-old rest ...

… His ghost teddy bear!

The haunted house is a very simple game, inside the box you will find some tiles that will be used to represent the rooms and corridors of the house.

After placing the tiles to represent a haunted house, place all the characters on the starting tile the last one who was in a haunted house starts playing! Roll the die, make your move and flip the arrival tile, performing the action shown on it.
The objective of the game is to find the tile containing the ghost bear and bring it back to him to win the game.

HALVES is a word game for the ruthless!

At home, the office, band practice, in the bar or on a plane (where this game was conceived!) bring your friends together and find out who is the wordiest of all.  
Be careful though, winning cards is the easy bit, staying in the lead is where things get complicated.

To win the game, simply Guess the word on your opponent’s card to win points. Be the player with the most points at the end of the game!

The active player must choose a word from one card in their hand for their opponents to try and guess. The colour behind the chosen word dictates the game type for the round:
- Yellow is CATEGORIES, 
- Blue is RHYMES WITH,
- Red is PERFECT PAIRS.

The active player must think of a clue for their word. Then they announce the game type and their clue to all players who have 30 seconds to guess it.
Any cards a player has won from a previous round is at risk from TRAP cards.

Guess, Swap, Bluff or Steal your way to put points on the table and be the envy of all your friends and family!

Created by Carter & Richardson the same minds that make up your favourite punk rock and roll band The Rattlesnakes.

Awards:
-1 Place best innovative mechanic in: 12th roll and write design contest.
-2 Place best Solitaire game in: 12th roll and write design contest.
-2 Place best game in: 12th roll and write design contest.
-2 Place best foreign language game in: 12th roll and write design contest.

B17 Twenty five Missions is a game in which we will live the experience inside a B17, and in which we will bomb various targets to overcome the goal of 25 missions to return home.

This is a Roll And Write mechanics game for one player with a minimum duration of 20 minutes.

To play it is recommended to have:

     The bomber sheet, the objectives sheet and if you are playing in campaign mode the mission report sheet (It is recommended that the sheets be with a polypropylene protector)
     An erasable marker.
     -Various D6 Dice


Objective:

Complete 1 match without the bomber being shot down.
Complete all 25 missions (campaign) with a single bomber.

Each player gets 20 playing pieces (cardboard tokens) to represent different army units: 
1 commander, 1 occupying force, 1 bulwark, 2 cavalry, 3 warplanes, 3 artillery, 3 tanks and 6 infantry.
The game board is a square grid with buildings and lakes as obstacles. Only the planes may move over the obstacles. each kind of unit has it's own way to move or to capture enemy units.
A unit is captured if an enemy unit gets on the same space.

The goal of the game is to capture the enemy commander or occupy the two corner spaces (marked with a star) in enemy territory.

The game was published during WW II.

Got what it takes to deliver? Prove you’re the best mail carrier in town with USPS: The Great American Mail Race, a lightly strategic and family-friendly game packed with nostalgia.

You now work for the beloved United States Postal Service and your mission is to deliver as much mail as possible to some of the best-named towns in America like Jackpot, Booger Hole, and Whynot!

Plan your mail route with Transport Cards using 13 official USPS methods of transportation, from pony express and 4x4 to hot-air balloon and rocket. Watch out for rival carriers who might “assist” you and take your mail!

Score points for delivering mail across four U.S. regions and earn bonus points for collecting Postcards, same-day deliveries, hometown pickups or delivering fragile parcels without air transport. Stamp your Delivery Slip using the included iconic USPS mailbox stamper to keep track.

Once the deck of Transport Cards runs out, add up the points.

The gods are divided. Rome has lost its way. We must restore its glory! With the favor of the gods, we shall lead our people to become the chosen tribe that will bring unity and strength to the empire once again.

Gods of Rome is a competitive area-control game that uses worker placement and card activation and lasts around 60 minutes. Players each choose a tribe at the start of the game and must lead that tribe to gain the gods' favor. On your turn, choose one of three actions:


     Visit a God: Gain a god's blessing token, which allows you to take an enhanced action later in the game, and place one meeple in that god's color — which might also be a player's color — on the game board in a matching-colored location.
     Activate a card: Place a token on an action space on your player board to add more figures to the board, move figures, and attack opponents. If you have a blessing token of the same color as the location where the action takes place, you can take an enhanced action.
     Score: Advance on the victory track depending on which territories you control in regions that match the gods you have visited, then clear all action spaces and remove your tokens from the god spaces. Special objectives change the scoring of territories from game to game.


The favor track features three checkpoints, and as players gain favor, they advance on this track; if a player hits a checkpoint, all players score points based on their relative position on the favor track, then they advance to the checkpoint. After a player reaches the third checkpoint, players again score points, then whoever has the highest overall score wins.

—description from publisher
